location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 33 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter discusses several administrative issues. The letter provides an update of the conflict between Persia and the Zeberra [Zubarah] Arabs including news of the arrival of forces in Congoon belonging to Shaikh Rashed of Galfar and Shaikh Abdulla of Ormuse [Hormuz] en route to join Shaikh Nasser's forces. The letter also mentions the war between the Chaub [the Banu Ka'b tribal confederacy] and the Turks as well as recent disputes between the Shaikhs of Bunderich [Bander-e Rig] and Genova [Bandar Ganaveh]. The letter also reports the safe arrival of Lieutenant Thomas Hardie to Bussora [Basra].
